content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
pig_latinify(strings)

strings = ["Hello, world!", "This is a pig Latin phrase.", "Can you translate this to pig Latin?"]

pig_latinify(strings)

strings

```

```julia
function pig_latinify(strings)
  threads = []
  for i in strings
    thread = Thread(pig_latin_translate(i))
    threads << thread
    thread.start()
  end

  for thread in threads
    thread.join()
  end

  return strings
end

function pig_latin_translate(str)
   vowels = ["a", "e", "i", "o", "u"]
  consonants = ["b", "d", "g", "h", "j", "k", "l", "m", "n", "p", "r", "s", "t", "v", "z"]

  s = split(str, " ")
  pig_latin_s = []
  for word in s
    consonants_in_word = findall(consonants, word)
    if consonants_in_word
      pig_latin_word = vowel_sound(word) ++ "ay"
    else
      pig_latin_word = word
    end
    pig_latin_s << pig_latin_word
  end

  return join(pig_latin_s, " ")
end

function vowel_sound(word)
  vowels = ["a", "e", "i", "o", "u"]
  sound = ""
  for i in vowels
    if word[1] == i
      sound = "ah"
      break
    end
  end
  return sound
end
```
